hints.content:
First, let's find the area and perimeter of the striped rectangle.  

[[☃ image 1]]

We can find area of a rectangle by multiplying its length by its width.  
Area $= \greenD4 \times \greenD6 = \greenD{24} \text{ sq cm}$ 

We find perimeter by adding the lengths of the sides.  
Perimeter $= \greenD4 + \greenD4 + \greenD6 + \greenD6 = \greenD{20} \text{ cm}$

options.alt: A wide rectangle. The left side of the rectangle is labeled 4 centimeters. The top side of the rectangle is labeled 6 centimeters. !

hints.content:
Next, we find the area and perimeter of the other rectangle. 

$$ | Area | Perimeter
:- | :- | :-
![A wide rectangle. The left side of the rectangle is labeled 4 centimeters. The top side of the rectangle is labeled 6 centimeters.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1422cf4afc6f10d900b5968ccb674504d47a3081) | $\greenD4 \!\times\!\! \greenD6 \!=\!\! \greenD{24} \text{ sq cm}$  | $\greenD4 \!+\!\! \greenD4 \!+\!\! \greenD6 \!+\!\! \greenD6 \!=\!\! \greenD{20} \text{ cm}$
![A square. The left side of the square is labeled 5 centimeters. The top side of the square is labeled 5 centimeters.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/87ac26c585a552f7beb2cb68c07bde45c39516d6) | $\purpleD5 \times \purpleD{5} = \purpleD{25} \text{ sq cm}$   | $\purpleD5 + \purpleD5 + \purpleD{5} + \purpleD{5} = \purpleD{20} \text{ cm}$

Now, lets compare the area and perimeters of the rectangles.

Area:  
$\greenD{24}\text { sq cm}\neq\purpleD{25}\text{ sq cm}$

Perimeter:  
$\greenD{20}\text { cm}=\purpleD{20}\text{ cm}$
The rectangles have the same perimeter only.
